headline: How Investors Are Reacting To Akamai Technologies (AKAM) Expanding Its AI Cloud And Payments Security Ecosystem
summary: In December 2025, Akamai Technologies launched ISV Catalyst, a referral-based partner program to help independent software vendors build, market, and sell AI-ready, cloud-native solutions on its distributed cloud platform, and announced a collaboration with Visa to secure agentic commerce using Visa’s Trusted Agent Protocol integrated with Akamai’s edge-based security tools. Together, these moves extend Akamai’s ecosystem on both the application and payments fronts, potentially deepening its...

headline: How New Analyst Views and Sector Pressures Are Rewriting the Story for Visa
summary: Visa's latest narrative update comes with a subtly lower fair value estimate, trimming the target from about $395.89 to $395.44 per share, while the discount rate edges up from roughly 7.39% to 7.41%. These fine tuned adjustments largely reflect a tug of war between robust, network driven growth in global payments and a more skeptical market tone toward the broader payments sector. Read on to see how these shifts fit into the evolving story for Visa and how you can stay tuned to future...

headline: Old lender, new twist: Shanghai Commercial Bank teams up with HashKey on credit card
summary: One of Hong Kong's oldest lenders is stepping up its push into digital finance, teaming up with newly listed digital asset exchange HashKey Exchange to launch a co-branded credit card in the first half of next year. Shanghai Commercial Bank (SCB), which marked its 75th anniversary this year, will partner with HashKey Exchange to issue a Visa credit card exclusively for investors trading on the digital asset platform, according to chief executive Wallace Lam Wing-ted. headline: Visa Analysis: U.S. Holiday Spending Rose 4.2%
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, December 23, 2025--Visa (NYSE: V), a global leader in digital payments, today released its annual Retail Spend Monitor from Visa Consulting & Analytics (VCA), offering a broad view of U.S. holiday retail activity. Preliminary data shows that overall holiday retail spending increased 4.2% year over year across all payment types, including cash and check. These figures are not adjusted for inflation.

content.title: Visa Analysis: U.S. Holiday Spending Rose 4.2%
content.summary: SAN FRANCISCO, December 23, 2025--Visa (NYSE: V), a global leader in digital payments, today released its annual Retail Spend Monitor from Visa Consulting & Analytics (VCA), offering a broad view of U.S. holiday retail activity. Preliminary data shows that overall holiday retail spending increased 4.2% year over year across all payment types, including cash and check. These figures are not adjusted for inflation.
